description:
- open a project in WebStorm that has no connection to an online git-repository
- rightclick on project root
- in menu goto Git -> Repository -> Push...
- click on "origin"
- click on "Define remote"
- paste URL to git-repository (note: rightclick paste doesn't work in windows)
- click ok

After doing all this a window appears with title "Choose GitHub Account". 

At the same time another window appears with title "Checking URL". This window stys there forever. Clicking "cancel" in this window disables the cancel-button. After a few minutes the window vanishes and it is possible to select an account in the other window saying "Choose GitHub Account".

It would be good, if the check for url is done AFTER the choosing of a github account, not at the same time.
summary: Webstorm - Push in Repository "Checking URL..." never ends

description:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Run IDEA on Linux with NVIDIA card.
2. use -Dsun.java2d.opengl=true and -Dsun.java2d.xrender=false in JVM options.

What is the expected result?

A fluid interface with smooth scroll and JCE working on plugins like Markdown preview.

What happens instead?

You get a  fluid interface with smooth scroll, but using JCE based plugins freeze IDE.

PS: everything work fine with -Dsun.java2d.opengl=true and -Dsun.java2d.xrender=false, except JCE... Without -Dsun.java2d.opengl=true and -Dsun.java2d.xrender=false, Jetbrains IDEs interface get absurdly slow a lot.
summary: JCE plugins freezes IDEA when using -Dsun.java2d.xrender=false -Dsun.java2d.opengl=true jvmoptions

description:
If you have two remotes in `.git/config` file and open that project in IDE. The IDE will fetch and save a list of remotes in `Git > Log (tab) > Git Branches (sidebar)`. 

However if you remote the remote from git config and open the project in IDE again, it will still keep in listing that remote. There is no way to refresh this.

What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Open a git repository project with 2 remotes.
2. Fetch in IDE so you can see branches listed on both remote in Git tool window (Log tab).
3. Remove a remote from git config file.
4. Open project in IDE again and the removed remote is still in Log tab.

What is the expected result?
It should keep the list of remotes synced with git config.

What happens instead?
It keeps a cached list of git remotes.
summary: Remove Remotes when Git Config is Updated

description:
Possibly reverting to "alphabetical" even though the option is not selected
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Set code completion options like so: (I think this is the default or pretty close to default) also having ML Assisted Completions on or off makes no difference
![](image.png)
2. In a java project have a simple block of code like this:
![](image1.png)

What's expected?
I expect to see bigDecimal2 as the first suggested completion because IntelliJ is smart and it knows I want to use it because I used it on the line before and this used to work 100%.

What happens instead?
As seen on the above screenshot the completion order is
- bigDecimal1
- bigDecimal2
even though bigDecimal2 is defined after bigDecimal1 and I have just used bigDecimal2 on the line immediately preceding this completion. 

It seems at least the variables and parameter completions are always sorted alphabetically even though that option is off. Having ML completions enabled makes absolutely no difference (and no up/down ranking arrows are visible in the completion popup either)

Even worse example:
![](image2.png)
In this code block IntelliJ is suggesting "params" first after typing "pa" instead of "paymentTransaction" that was used on 6 previous lines.

I've invalidated caches and restarted to no avail. There is nothing suspicious in the idea.log. System info below. The project is using latest AdoptOpenJDK 8.

System Info:
======================================
IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2.2 (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-202.7319.50, built on September 15, 2020
Licensed to ****
Subscription is active until April 27, 2021
Runtime version: 11.0.8+10-b944.31 x86_64
VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o.
macOS 10.15.6
GC: ParNew, ConcurrentMarkSweep
Memory: 725M
Cores: 12
Non-Bundled Plugins: com.intellij.gwt
summary: Java completion ordering broken

comments.text: Just saw the latest updates. Am I absolutely dreaming that this used to work in previous versions? That is so annoying. And I have never been annoyed with IntelliJ before!!!
@roman.5 it looks like we never considered the proximity of local variables to rank completion options. Could you please ensure that this actually worked before?

description:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. In OSX settings, got accessibility, then zoom and enable Hover Text.  This allows pressing Cmd on text to zoom it up.
2. Open PyCharm 2020.2.3
3. Dropdown any of the main menus - e.g. PyCharm
4. Move over a menu item, such as About PyCharm
5. Press CMD to activate hover text

What is the expected result?
To see "About PyCharm" in the hover text zoom box.

What happens instead?
PyCharm crashes.  It immediately disappears with no errors.

Please provide any additional information below.
I've been noticing that PyCharm has been crashing a lot recently, so it's not a new problem in 2020.2.3 which I've only just installed.  But I've only just discovered that this particularly action causes it to crash.  Chances are there are other places where this happens too.

It's very annoying.

I'm using Catalina 10.15.6
summary: Using OSX Hover text zoom accessibility option on main app menu crashes PyCharm

description:
With this EAP build the File/Open dialog recognizes directories containing a 'iml' file as an Idea project directory, and offers the standard options of "This Window", and open in "New Window" and "Cancel"

The "New Window" choice causes the UI to briefly blink, but no new project window is created.

I've tried opening the iml file, and the pom.xml files - and they are opened as files, without the offer to open them as projects.

Choosing 'This Window' returns to the Welcome screen (No project Window)

The project also fails to open from the 'Welcome' screen - not certain how the last project got into the project list on the Welcome screen - that seems to be the only one that opens normally.

See issues 5881011 and 5881015 for a bug reports that may have a stack trace related to this behavior

IU-203.4449.2, JRE 11.0.8+10-b1098.1x64 JetBrains s.r.o., OS Windows 7(amd64) v6.1 Service Pack 1, screens 3200.0x1800.0

If you select a directory in File | Open action - IDE will offer to open it as a project. It has been working like so for quite some time. Can you clarify the expected behaviour and how it differs from earlier behaviour?

>The "New Window" choice causes the UI to briefly blink, but no new project window is created.

> Having a full error would also be useful and idea.log (Help | Show Log in ... action) containing the time after update and until issue occurred.

Oh... As I said, I've back to 2020.2.2 and cleaned up all related to IntelliJ IDEA caches/logs etc.
I'll try to reproduce this issue in several hours.

description:
At the moment there're no public keys to change flame graph colors, but we need to resolve the next problems:

1. give a user a chance to change the default flame graph color scheme
2. describe how are theme keys created to customize flame graph in custom themes (we have several types of cells, e.g.: native, java, kernel, etc.)
3. add support for several themes (see: [IDEA-222039](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-222039))
summary: Add flame graph color scheme editor to tune colours and manage schemes

comments.text: also allow to set custom colors for project-specific packages/methods (possibly specified with a regexp)

description:
Some APIs may have the same arguments in different order. 
Nice example, if I recall it well, is JUnit vs TestNG - the first thing has assertEuals(expected, actual), the second assertEuals(actual, expected). 

It would be helpful **to be able to swap arguments, the selected one with the following one, via a keyboard** shortcut (or action with assignable shortcut). 
This is not about changing method signature, i.e. reordering its parameters, it's just about the arguments.
summary: ability to swap method arguments via keyboard shortcut

comments.text: Hello Rostislav - you should be able to do it with `Ctrl+Alt+Shift+Left/Right` ('**Move Element Left / Right**' action).

description:
Hi!
If there is a Runnable implementation in the call chain IDEA tries to add all calls on all Runnable implementations in the project and all libraries to the tool window, which leads to high RAM and CPU load (100%) and the app stuck. The one way to finish it - is to restart IDEA.
Expected behavior: add calls only for current Runnable implementation
![](image.png)

IU-202.7319.50, JRE 11.0.8+10-b944.31x64 JetBrains s.r.o., OS Windows 10(amd64) v10.0 , screens 2048x1152, 1536x864, 1536x960
summary: Call hierarchy (Ctrl-Alt-H) leads to 100% CPU load on Runnable implementation

comments.text: Please provide the thread dumps: https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/206544899 .
From pressing Ctrl-Alt-H until the call tree loaded

Likely the same Kotlin plug-in specific issue as those I've linked.

description:
Now completion is available only if `in: path` property is present

Let's complete if it is missing too. In this case after completion is invoked both parameter name and `in` property with `path` value should be added
summary: Swagger path variable reference completion improvements

description:
https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/170230081

IC-202.7319.50, JRE 11.0.8+10x64 Oracle Corporation, OS Linux(amd64) v5.8.13-arch1-1, screens 2560x1440
summary: PulseAudio is crackling continiously while Intellij IDEA Community Edition is running

comments.text:
Can you clarify the problem please. Do you mean that sounds from PulseAudio are produced with a delays or not working? Do you have it for certain applications?

Can you record a sample showing the problem? From the video in AS issue tracker the problem is not quite clear.

Have you tried searching for solutions like https://askubuntu.com/questions/707171/how-can-i-fix-choppy-audio ?

Please check also if it makes a different to enable File | Power Save Mode or leave the IDE idle for a while?

Please attach all IDE logs (Help | Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data) and OS system log at the moment when issue happens. Not sure if PulseAudio has any diagnostics logs, if it has please attach it also. Thanks.

> Can you clarify the problem please. Do you mean that sounds from PulseAudio are produced with a delays or not working?
> 
> Can you record a sample showing the problem? From the video in AS issue tracker the problem is not quite clear.

I think I can't help if you don't hear a problem, these loud glitches. I can suggest you to use some audio-spectrum maybe. And sorry, but I don't understand "a sample showing the problem", when the existing record is it.

I can highlight some timestamps on this video: 1:12, 1:17, 1:31, 3:10, 3:43, 3:58, 4:00, 4:26, 4:28.

But after reviewing a record I noticed that there are a way less these glitches than I hear in real-life. I don't know how to record them properly.

I've attached a new video, with Intellij IDEA, highlights are: 0:55, 0:59, 1:43, 1:46, 2:02, 2:17.

You can also see the System Monitor, glitches are here even in idle state, with regular CPU usage.

> Do you have it for certain applications?

I've tested Chromium and Spotify (desktop client), I'm not interested in other audio applications.

> Have you tried searching for solutions like https://askubuntu.com/questions/707171/how-can-i-fix-choppy-audio ?

In the AS issue you can see a link to the question on the same Ask Ubuntu: https://askubuntu.com/questions/1183509/pulseaudio-lags-horribly-only-when-android-studio-is-running

There is pretty similar question to my: I've also tried listed solutions, including disabling timer-based audio scheduling (this is also mentioned in Arch Wiki: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/PulseAudio/Troubleshooting#Glitches,_skips_or_crackling).

> Please check also if it makes a different to enable File | Power Save Mode or leave the IDE idle for a while?

Yes, glitches are happening in Power Save Mode.

> Please attach all IDE logs (Help | Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data)

Done.

> and OS system log at the moment when issue happens

I don't know where is a "OS system log" for Arch Linux, but I see nothing in `journalctl -f` at these moments.

> Not sure if PulseAudio has any diagnostics logs, if it has please attach it also.

I've attached the output of `pulseaudio -vvvvv` (after `pulseaudio -k`). You can see strange lines, almost all of them were at sound cracks, but not on every crack there was a record in output. Then I've paused the video and you can see disconnection logs. Then, at `---` line (added manually), I've closed Intellij IDEA and resumed the video, so these logs, after `---`, are "normal".

Thank you for details. Latter video describe the problem better. Have no ideas what could be causing this. See no issues in IDE log. I'd assume that this could be some bug of audio driver or PulseAudio. Not sure if it is related to CPU consumption as the audio chokes also what IDE is idle as far as I can see from the last video. It would probably make sense to report the issue to PulseAudio https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/pulseaudio/pulseaudio/-/issues with logs provided.

From the IDE's side I could suggest to try using different JBR to run IDE under: https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/switching-boot-jdk.html (try 8 or 11 versions).

> I'd assume that this could be some bug of audio driver or PulseAudio. Not sure if it is related to CPU consumption as the audio chokes also what IDE is idle as far as I can see from the last video. It would probably make sense to report the issue to PulseAudio https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/pulseaudio/pulseaudio/-/issues with logs provided.

OK, thank you, created: https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/pulseaudio/pulseaudio/-/issues/1003

> to try using different JBR

Sorry, what is JBR? 

> (try 8 or 11 versions)

I've tried 14 and 11 locally installed OpenJDK version and there is the same problem.

>Sorry, what is JBR?

JetBrains Runtime. We use [our own Java Runtime](https://bintray.com/jetbrains/intellij-jdk) to run the IDE. It has many bug fixes and better font rendering support https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/206544879
@adernov OK, thank you. Please, help me: in runtime selector I see versions like `jbsdk11b125` and `jbrsdk-11_0_8`, what the difference, what is better?

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1.Close all instances of Intellij
2.Start Intellij, on Wndows 10 "C:\Program Files\JetBrains\IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2\bin\idea64.exe"
3.See Splash comes up...
4.See main editor window come up.
5. Status bar comes up while loading last project
6. Hit cancel.
7. Window destroyed... all stops.
8. Try to start again: "C:\Program Files\JetBrains\IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2\bin\idea64.exe"
9. Won't start.
10. Check windows tasks... orphaned Inteillij task found.
11, Kill task, and once again,
12. "C:\Program Files\JetBrains\IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2\bin\idea64.exe"  and it does start again.

What is the expected result?

How this used to work, is when step #6 is performed, a dialog will come up with all recent project to select from and when selected it would start that project rather than the most recent. Much better behavior, IMO.
summary: Intellij will hang task process on a cancel during initial load

description:
1) This is maven project with avro codegen to "target/generated-sources"
2) maven goal "generate-sources" is set to be pre compile step
3) "target/generate-sources" marked as source root
4) Use IJ compiler (do NOT delegate build to maven)
5) hit compile
6) compile triggers mvn generate-sources
7) source are generated into "target/generate-sources" 
8) compilation fails as it cannot find generated classes (BAD)
9) classes are there and navigating to error resolves everything fin in editor
10) hitting compile second time triggers gen sources again and succeeds with no issues

It looks like a bug as requires to trigger compile twice even if pre compile step generated all the correct code.
It looks like compiler did not pickup new files that were added after hitting 'compile' button.
summary: Compiler does not pick up generated sources if they were produced by pre compile step (Maven)

description:
I would very much like to see support for diffing things come to light edit mode. In particular, textual diff/merge functionality would be very useful in light edit mode.

Today I needed to diff some text in my browser with some text in a file, and I don't have great text editing tools other than IntelliJ. So I went and opened IntelliJ in light edit mode thinking I could just right click on some text and choose "compare with clipboard". Much to my dismay, the option isn't there.

Is it _really_ a big deal if I have to open a project to use the diff tools? Not at all. But it would be nice to have this capability. :-)
summary: Add diff support to light edit mode

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Check out https://github.com/fjalvingh/domui, branch master-java11
2. Import into IntelliJ as a maven project
3. Rebuild Project

What is the expected result?
The build works without errors

What happens instead?
The build fails with "XXX cannot be resolved" errors for the classes that are generated by the annotation processor. It appears that either it does not run or its files are not generated.

This worked just fine with all previous versions of the IDE, and it started failing quite recently with the EAP version (I think about one week ago). I can see the annotation processor is recognized from Maven, and the output path is marked as sources:
![](image.png)

After a maven build (which works fine) the annotated classes are present:
![](image1.png)

Doing a CTRL+F9 rebuild will then work. But when you again do "Rebuild Project" the build again fails with the same errors - but the classes generated by Maven remain in the generated-sources directory.

comments.text:
as a workaround, until the fix is available you can use the flag

-Djps.track.ap.dependencies=false

which should be added to File | Settings | Build, Execution, Deployment | Compiler | Build process VM options field.
Thanks a lot for fixing this Eugene! I will try it in the next update.

I should thank you for reporting this. It turned out that I have missed the case when META-INF service registration is missing from the classpath, but processors can still be discovered if processor class name is explicitly specified.

description: Add possibility to ignore the values of the particular annotations.
summary: Define particular annotations to be ignored by Hardcoded strings inspection

comments.text: One needs to annotate corresponding annotation interface method(s) as `@NonNls` in code or externally. I don't think that it's feasible to add one more option here

Hey, I am the one that caused this issue to be created.
First of all thank you for the workaround using external annotations of `@NonNls`.
But what I was "really" asking for was to ignore annotation element values altogether for the given inspection because as per [JLS Chapter 9](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.7) an annotation element value can only contain constant expressions ([JLS Chapter 15](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-15.html#jls-15.28)), class literals, enum constants or other annotations (or ConditionalExpressions or ElementValueArrayInitializer that contain those) all of which are by definition not translatable (or at least not in a way that I currently know).
I just does not make sense to have any annotation element value be contained in this inspection.

description:
Since IntelliJ IDEA v2020.3 EAP, branch filter can be changed by double clicking a branch name. This is good but there is no way to reset except manually selecting `Branch : All` from branch filter dropdown. I have following recommendation for UX improvement.

1. __There should be a better way to automatically reset to `Branch : All`__ e.g. Adding `Branch : All` option in branch list above `Head (Current Branch)`. In v2020.2 clicking on branch group name used to reset the branch filter.

description:
When a project has test classes that have a dependency on another module in that project it can cause a run configuration build to fail.

This problem appears to be due to IntelliJ trying to skip resolving the test dependencies when building for runtime but still compiles the test classes.
If you check the `Build Output` when the build is triggered from the run configuration `some-test-dep` isn't included, but if you trigger a full project build it is included.

**What steps will reproduce the issue?**
1. Extract the attached zip `intellij-test-build-bug.zip`
2. Open the contained maven project in IntelliJ
3. Navigate to `some-app/src/main/java/Main` and Run the main method:
![](image.png)
4. You should get a compiler error like the following
```
intellij-test-build-bug\some-dep\src\test\java\dev\zero\intellijbug\SomeTestClass.java:9:13
java: cannot find symbol
  symbol:   class SomeDepClass
  location: class dev.zero.intellijbug.SomeTestClass
```

**What is the expected result?**
The application should build and run without any errors.

**Work around**
As a way to work around this problem you can trigger a full build via the `Build -> Build Project` or by using the maven compile or package lifecycle's once before running the application.

To get back to the state where the compile error will show up run the maven clean lifecycle or delete `some-dep/target/` and `some-test-dep/target/`.

---

**Environment**
- Windows 10
- IntelliJ 20202.2.3 _(via Toolbox)_
- adopt-openjdk-15 _(installed via IntelliJ "Download JDK" feature)_
summary: Run configuration build fails due to test class dependency

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
This issue occurs randomly.  However, it seems to me that it is a "cache" race condition.  I am able to restart IDE with import static resolving.  The slower the IDE starts the more likely import statics will resolve.
1.IDE must be completely closed 
2.Start any IDE project
3.State another IDE project
4.The second will resolve import statics (likely) BUT not the first.

What is the expected result?
All *user defined* static imports (not JDK) resolve like usual.

What happens instead?
Greyed out unresolved references

This looks like a similar problem that occurred before? IDEA-61813 maybe?

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Download Gradle 6.6.1
2. Generate new project with `gradle init` (type=application, language=kotlin, build-script-dsl=kotlin)
3. Open project in IntelliJ and reimport the Gradle project to trigger downloading all plugins, dependencies and source jars.
4. Open build.gradle.kts file
5. configure test task in any way

What is the expected result?
There are no syntax errors.

What happens instead?
- `tasks.withType<Test> {}` is marked as an error with the message `"Type argument is not within its bounds."`. (See attached screenshot.)
- The superclass being marked in red in the JavaDoc leads me to believe that this problem may be a classpath problem related to resolving the superclass AbstractTestTask.
- Navigating to implementaion works with all classes in the hierarchy despite the superclass being marked as red.
- The breadcrumbs for the file show `<class initializer>` for the three lines configuring the test task. This is however also the case for the other configuration lambdas where the syntax-check is ok. Just thought that that is weird.
- Gradle finishes configuration and test execution phases without any errors. This leads me to believe that all classes are present at the very least during execution and that it is IntelliJs classpath mechanism that does not find them all.
- Autocomplete works to some degree: Basic code completion finds the generics-based `withType()` extension method in the kotlin-dsl subproject of the gradle sources but navigate to implementation navigates to the java-based gradle api.
- The behaviour is unrelated to the version of the kotlin.jvm gradle buildscript plugin.
- The IntelliJ kotlin plugin version is 1.4.10-release-IJ2020.2-1

This issue may possibly be related to KT-42535 where the classpath for gradle kotlin-dsl scripts is also broken.

More information about the system:
```
Gradle 6.6.1 running on AdoptOpenJDK 14.0.1+7 on Windows 10

IntelliJ IDEA 2020.3 EAP (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-203.4449.2, built on October 6, 2020

2. Go to http://localhost:43000/

5. Edit in VIM
6. Refresh the web page and see that the changes do show up

IU-203.4449.2, JRE 11.0.8+10-b1098.1x64 JetBrains s.r.o., OS Mac OS X(x86_64) v10.15.6, screens 3360.0x2100.0, 3840.0x2160.0; Retina
summary: File saving doesn't update files in bind mounted Docker volumes

comments.text: Do you see the file updated on disk after you File | Save All in the IDE?
Yes, the file changes are present if you open the file on the host Mac using VIM after autosave or File | Save All.

So, IDE saves the changes and it's up to the Docker/FS to sync these changes to the container. IDE doesn't do anything specific when saving the files. It's not clear why Docker is not synchronizing this change.

> CACHING OPTIONS FOR VOLUME MOUNTS (DOCKER DESKTOP FOR MAC)
> You can configure container-and-host consistency requirements for bind-mounted directories in Compose files to allow for better performance on read/write of volume mounts. These options address issues specific to osxfs file sharing, and therefore are only applicable on Docker Desktop for Mac.

> The flags are:

> consistent: Full consistency. The container runtime and the host maintain an identical view of the mount at all times. This is the default.
> cached: The hostâ€™s view of the mount is authoritative. There may be delays before updates made on the host are visible within a container.
> delegated: The container runtimeâ€™s view of the mount is authoritative. There may be delays before updates made in a container are visible on the host.

Does it help if you change `cached` to `consistent` in `docker-compose.yml`?

Changing `cached` to `consistent` doesn't help either. I just tested editing files in Sublime Text and am experiencing the same issue. It's probably a Docker bug then. Thanks for the help troubleshooting!

description:
# What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Set up a workspace with a JDK, let's call it "Java 11"
2. Just to be extra sure, also set the jdkName in the Gradle build file: `idea.project.jdkName = "Java 11"

# What is the expected result?
"Java 11" is set as the project's SDK and no additional SDKs are created on sync

# What happens instead?
A new SDK called "11" is created. This SDK is never used. It doesn't cause any issues, but colleagues get worried that it might cause problems when they see it.
summary: Gradle sync creates unused Java SDK entry

comments.text: On a related note, it also creates a "Kotlin SDK" that is never used (since dependency management is done by Gradle, so Kotlin libraries are managed by Gradle).

description:
**To reproduce:** 
1. In "Formatter Control" make sa scope containing some files which must not be formatted by the IDE. 
(in my case a set of test verification files which has to be exactly as they were and should never ever be changed by IDEA (or the testsuite will be red)).

2. Make sure that any of these files has trailing spaces. 

3. Do something that issues a save of files in the editor. (I.e. save / commit / run a test etc.) 

4. Notice that the file that should never be formatted according to the settings in Formatter Control still was. 


**What is the expected result?**
That IDEA do not strip trailing spaces when we said "do never format these files".

**What happens instead?**
It did. 

It is actually quite a nuisance for us. :-(
summary: Strip trailing spaces on save should honor Formatter Control settings

description:
My project uses TestNG 6.9.8 which used http URL for testng-1.0.dtd:
```org.testng.xml.Parser
public static final String TESTNG_DTD_URL = "http://testng.org/testng-1.0.dtd";
```

When running the tests in Maven the same http URL is used in the suite:
```target\test-classes\testng.xml
<!DOCTYPE suite SYSTEM "http://testng.org/testng-1.0.dtd" >
```

But when I launch a test in IDEA (Ctrl+Shift+F10) it apparently renders the suite using newer TestNG version and https URL:
```AppData\Local\JetBrains\IntelliJIdea2020.3\temp-testng-customsuite.xml
<!DOCTYPE suite SYSTEM "https://testng.org/testng-1.0.dtd">
```

And then I get the connection error below even though normally there shouldn't have been any network requests.

P.S. I have HTTP proxy configured in IDEA as well as on the system level (HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY env variables).

```
org.testng.TestNGException: java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
	at org.testng.TestNG.initializeSuitesAndJarFile(TestNG.java:321)
	at com.intellij.rt.testng.IDEARemoteTestNG.run(IDEARemoteTestNG.java:39)
	at com.intellij.rt.testng.RemoteTestNGStarter.main(RemoteTestNGStarter.java:109)
Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect
	at java.net.DualStackPlainSocketImpl.connect0(Native Method)
	at java.net.DualStackPlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(DualStackPlainSocketImpl.java:79)
	at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.doConnect(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:350)
	at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(AbstractPlainSocketImpl.java:206)
...
	at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1492)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getInputStream(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:263)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLEntityManager.setupCurrentEntity(XMLEntityManager.java:647)
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLEntityManager.startEntity(XMLEntityManager.java:1304)
...
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.SAXParserImpl.parse(SAXParserImpl.java:327)
	at javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser.parse(SAXParser.java:195)
	at org.testng.xml.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:38)
	at org.testng.xml.SuiteXmlParser.parse(SuiteXmlParser.java:16)
	at org.testng.xml.SuiteXmlParser.parse(SuiteXmlParser.java:9)
	at org.testng.xml.Parser.parse(Parser.java:172)
	at org.testng.TestNG.initializeSuitesAndJarFile(TestNG.java:301)
```
summary: Cannot run TestNG test from IDEA - Connection timed out

comments.text: @sabio, can you please share a little sample project where the issue is reproduced for you (haven't managed to reproduce with my simple testng suite project). Is the issue still reproduced if you disable proxy? Thank you

I think the problem is that IDEA does not have https proxy. It only has options for HTTP and SOCKS.
And remote TestNG needs to use https proxy to access the https DTD link.

So there are two problems here:
1) IDEA uses TestNG 7.x to generate data (temp-testng-customsuite.xml) for TestNG 6.8.9
(Then TestNG 6.8.9 does not recognize the https DTD URL and tries to fetch it instead of using the bundled one.)
2) There are no https proxy settings in IDEA so TestNG 6.8.9 cannot access the https URL to download the DTD

Fixing either of them would eliminate the problem. But I believe both this issues should be fixed.

I've realized that IDEA has no problem downloading plugin updates. Which I suppose happens over https?
So https proxy is used in IDEA. (Does it apply http proxy settings to https as well?)

But somehow the test runner does not get these proxy settings. And probably it does not even get http proxy either.
@sabio It should not, I suppose. It's your tests and they should not use any IDEA's settings. I've changed the generated suite so for old testng versions it doesn't use "https" versions of dtd.

Fair enough.

However when I run the tests in Maven it uses (I suppose) system settings via the environment variables.
But IDEA does not take those variables into account when running the tests.

How am I supposed to pass the environment settings to the tests? I do not want to add `-Dhttp.proxy...` to every ad-hoc test run.
And adding these to some template does not work either if environment changes (VPN => use proxy, no VPN => no proxy).

IDEA generates test suite outside of test process while maven does it in the same process. I don't think that testng run from maven loads dtd from internet, it must recognise the dtd url and loads dtd from resources of that jar. 
I didn't see any code in testng to pass proxies but you may contact testng team for this question. But again I don't think that IDE should pass any such settings to tests automatically.
I cannot make the tests run from IDEA, the only solution is to use Maven or do not use TestNG, not very intelligent...
Is it possible to generate a Maven command to run only 1 test from IDEA?

You could add `-Dhttps.proxyHost=... -Dhttps.proxyPort=...` to the VM parameters of the test run configuration.
Or upgrade your project to TestNG 7.x

It's probably better to put these settings into the TestNG run configuration template. This way they will be applied automatically every time you press Ctrl+Shift+F10.
Maybe right-click the green triangle near the test method and possibility to "Run with Maven"?

@anet 
You are right. Maven probably does not do anything with env variables by default.

So the only not annoying solution is to avoid any Internet access in the tests.
Otherwise enabling/disabling VPN would require manual flipping of the tests proxy settings in IDEA.

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. create a maven project with a test unit
2. create a run/debug configuration for that test unit, and set Java 8 as JRE
3. run test unit

What is the expected result?
It should run the test.

What happens instead?
Getting error:
Unrecognized option: --illegal-access=permit
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.

Environment:
Mac 10
Intellij idea 2019.2 (192.5728)

It seems Intellij idea is passing "--illegal-access" option regardless of java version.
Overwriting the option in "JVM options" doesn't help since this option is not supported in JVM 8.
summary: Error in executing test "Unrecognized option: --illegal-access=permit"

comments.text: @rahimi.mnr Is it possible to attach sample project example?

@Yaroslav.Bedrov cannot share the main project but I tried to create a sample project, and it worked.
So my assumption is something wrong in .idea folder. Will try to remove the .idea folder and open project again.
It didn't help.
@rahimi.mnr Don't you have .iml file in project root? You might delete it as well. Is it possible to attach your pom.xml?

Removing .iml didn't help. Cannot share the pom.xml but there is nothing special.

More info:
I was checking the Intellij-idea community code on Github (192.5728 branch), and couldn't file any place you set --illegal-access parameter.
Also I searched installation path to find --illegal-access as string somewhere, and the only place is in libjvm.dylib (/Applications/IntelliJ IDEA.app/Contents/jbr/Contents/Home/lib/server). I think this is bundled JRE 11.
Not sure even if this is Intellij-idea bug or Java one.
@rahimi.mnr Does it work fine if you use Maven goal to run test?
Yes, it does.
@rahimi.mnr Don't you have "--illegal-access" option in your pom.xml? Also please check that it not passed via "Preferences| Build, Execution, Deployment | Build Tools | Maven | Runner" options.
No I don't have it, and no VM option in the Maven Runner options.

Ah! I could workaround issue with changing Maven home directory from "Bundled" to my Maven installation.
So it's bundled Maven.

Still sounds like a bug to me, but up to you, if we should close this issue or not.
Thanks for your time @Yaroslav.Bedrov !

description:
After an upgrade to IntelliJ IDEA 2020.x version, navigation from a feature file into the step definition method takes much longer time than it used to be. It takes approx.. 10 seconds now.

```
IntelliJ IDEA 2020.2.1 (Ultimate Edition)

macOS 10.15.7

summary: Navigation from feature file to step definition takes 10+ seconds

comments.text: In my case it often takes even longer

Do you experience UI hanging when issue happens? For the investigation could you please provide the CPU snapshot (Help | Diagnostic Tools | Start/Stop CPU Usage Profiling action) taken at the very moment of reproduction and all logs zipped (Help | Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data action)? Thank you.

@adernov, no, I don't experience UI hanging. I see a modal window:
![](Screenshot 2020-10-07 at 15.40.35.png)
I can move it, I see the animation of the loading bar. It seems to be responsive.

Also, the navigation is not so slow all the time. Sometimes it works immediately, sometimes it's slow. Right now, the first step navigation was slow and all subsequent navigations were quick. I opened several different classes.
Logs attached.

Do you work with Java files? If you do not use Kotlin, please try with Kotlin plugin disabled. Does it help?

Please also try disabling these plugins to check if this helps: `Loaded custom plugins: AceJump (3.6.3), Frame Switcher (3.23.1-193), Key Promoter X (2020.2), Awesome Console (0.1337.9), CheckStyle-IDEA (5.44.0), Jump to Line (0.1.2), detekt (1.6.0), Selenium UI Automation Testing (202.6948.5), Prettier (202.6948.5),  Package Search (1.0.1191-eap), AsciiDoc (0.31.33)`

summary: git doesn't detect local changes

description:
Today I launched IDEA and IDEA just froze during startup. I got a window with only the title bar and otherwise just grey area. I could not even close IDEA anymore. The console output suggests that this was due to the Gauge-Plugin. Eventually IDEA came to live after all. The full console log is attached. The "highlights" are here:
```
2020-10-08 07:30:10,930 [   7730]  ERROR - tworks.gauge.core.GaugeVersion - Unable to start Gauge Intellij plugin.Could not find executable in `PATH`. Please make sure Gauge is installed.
If Gauge is installed then set the Gauge executable path in settings -> tools -> gauge.
[..]
2020-10-08 07:30:11,066 [   7866]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Initializing Gauge connection 
2020-10-08 07:31:06,082 [  62882]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 1. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:32:06,091 [ 122891]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 2. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:33:06,106 [ 182906]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 3. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:34:06,119 [ 242919]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 4. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:35:06,134 [ 302934]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 5. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:36:06,150 [ 362950]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 6. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:37:06,161 [ 422961]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 7. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:38:06,171 [ 482971]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 8. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:39:06,183 [ 542983]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 9. Waiting and trying again 
2020-10-08 07:40:06,194 [ 602994]   WARN - orks.gauge.GaugeModuleListener - Unable to open connection on try 10. Waiting and trying again 
Could not add gauge lib, add it manually: Gauge api connection not established
```
I have never used Gauge, so it is not surprising that gauge is not installed. However I had never problems with IDEA about that before. However the project I had opened when closing IDEA yesterday was a Firefox browser extension and within that the file `manifest.json` was the last file opened. After IDEA eventually started that file opened and I noticed that in the lower right corner it says "JSON: Gauge 1.0 Manifest". So I guess that IDEA tried to contact a (not existing) gauge service for the first time due to this reason. It is unfortunate though, that this makes the IDE completely unusable for 10 minutes.
summary: Gauge plugin freezes IDEA at startup for 10 minutes although the gauge plugin is not even used

comments.text:
Hi,
Thanks for the feedback. Recently we have released IntelliJ IDEA 2020.3 EAP with updated Gauge plugin where the gauge init process has been reworked and it will no longer freeze the IDE.
Could you please try it https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/nextversion/?
I tried with the EAP and indeed that fixed the issue.

Building the project with Gradle works fine though. I have tried syncing with both Gradle 5.6.4 and Gradle 6.6.1 (after migrating some things), but both result in the same error message. I also tried with IntelliJ 2020.2.3 but also ran into the same error.
The repository for which this occurs (https://github.com/metaborg/devenv) is kind of complicated, but the following should bring the repository into a state in which it can be imported into IntelliJ:

```
git clone --single-branch --branch develop git@github.com:metaborg/devenv.git
cd devenv
./gradlew repoUpdate
```

After that, it can be imported into IntelliJ with Gradle 5.6.4 (cannot use the wrapper in IntelliJ because the `gradle-wrapper.properties` is in a non-standard location)

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Load a mixed project created with a previous version of the IDEA that has a module created from an Eclipse .classpath

What is the expected result?
Project opens normally

What happens instead?
IntelliJ opens the main window briefly and closes, then showing this error:

--------------------------------
**Cannot execute command**
No project found to open file in

--------------------------------

idea.log attached
summary: Mixed module project (eclipse module, man module) not opening in latest EAP

description:
Every time when I add or modify a remote, IDEA spends a bit of my time in this modal dialog:
![](image.png)

I have a couple of cases when this is unwanted:
1. Often I copy a remote address from a GitHub page, and I know for fact that it's valid. I don't want the IDE to check it again for me.
2. Sometimes I rename remotes (often in cases when I have created a repository fork on GitHub, and want to rename `origin` to `upstream`). Remove couldn't become invalid after rename, and thus its checking is absolutely unnecessary if I've just renamed it.

I believe that both of these cases would be solved if the **Define Remote** dialog (see the image below) would include a checkbox "Verify remote connection", even if enabled by default. In cases when I don't want to verify the connection, I would turn it off and have a little bit of my time spared.
![](image1.png)
summary: Allow to disable verification/check of remote after edit/add
Add "binarily" to built-in dictionary

description:
1) Clone the project: https://github.com/mohamed-taman/Springy-Store-Microservices (the revision I checked was 786c0c7cf62364c94fe9a148310567c9adbfb244)
2) Go to store-common -> store-utils
3) Select store-utils in Project Hierarchy tree
4) Choose Tools -> Generate JavaDoc...
5) Choose the scope Module 'store-utils', set up output directory and run generation

The error occurs:
.../store-common/store-utils/src/main/java/com/siriusxi/ms/store/util/http/HttpErrorInfo.java:23: error: records are a preview feature and are disabled by default.
public record HttpErrorInfo(
       ^
  (use --enable-preview to enable records)
Seems, we must add --enable-preview parameter in the command line (com.intellij.javadoc.JavadocGeneratorRunProfile.MyJavaCommandLineState#setParameters).
Probably -source, -target level must be added as well. 

PS
Similar problems occur in the project related to Java preview-features.

description:
Because the menu checkmark icon (`idea/community/platform/platform-impl/src/com/intellij/ide/ui/laf/icons/intellij/checkmark.svg`) uses a different shade of gray (`#3E3E3C`) instead of the action icon gray (`#6E6E6E`) it not only looks darker. It also ignores the color value provided by the UI theme.

![](image.png)

The same can be said about the menu checkmark icon from the default dark scheme (`idea/community/platform/platform-impl/src/com/intellij/ide/ui/laf/icons/darcula/checkmark.svg`). It uses white (`#FFF`) while other icons use other color (`#AFB1B3`).

I would also suggest to review other LaF icons -- it seems they use the colors which are no longer in use in other places of the UI. And these colors are effectifely hard-coded values.
summary: Menu checkmark icons ignore theming

The commit that changed the behavior is
https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community/commit/11183b5162cbce9e22558047a0ff2a0415c49f77

After swapping the bytecode with an older version I got it how it was before.

If someone wants to get the older behavior, since this is really **annoying**, it's possible to use Recaf (as in this case, or others) to edit the bytecode.
Starting from `{IDEA-INSTALL-DIR}\lib\platform-impl.jar\com\intellij\openapi\editor\impl\EditorGutterComponentImpl.class`
```
1 DEFINE PRIVATE calcAnnotationExtraSize()V
```
Then
```
24 INVOKEDYNAMIC test ()Ljava/util/function/Predicate; ${H_META} args[(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z, handle[H_INVOKESTATIC com/intellij/openapi/editor/impl/EditorGutterComponentImpl.lambda$calcAnnotationExtraSize$5(Ljava/awt/Component;)Z], (Ljava/awt/Component;)Z]
25 INVOKESTATIC com/intellij/ui/ComponentUtil.findParentByCondition(Ljava/awt/Component;Ljava/util/function/Predicate;)Ljava/awt/Component;
```
must be replaced with
```
24 INVOKESTATIC javax/swing/SwingUtilities.getWindowAncestor(Ljava/awt/Component;)Ljava/awt/Window;
```

description:
I've primarily hit this while working on a custom plugin when `idea.log` for the debug instance is displayed in a Java debugger tab. If the debug instance ends up emitting a HUGE amount of log entries--not uncommon when you've enabled debug logging for complex behaviors--you can find yourself waiting a significant amount of time for that view to catch up. This is expensive not only in terms of time, but also in terms of CPU as the dev instance is busy processing each and every log entry until it's caught up.

I've actually had to kill the running dev instance, close the debug tab, and restart the debugger in order to get things back into a usable state.

It would be great if there were some way to tell those views to skip straight to the bottom of the log and ignore everything in between. If there's already a way to do that, please let me know as I've been unable to find it so far.

FYI, I saw IDEA-13096, but that does not solve this for me. I have this behavior occurring right now where nothing new is being written to `idea.log`, but the debugger's `idea.log` tab is WAY behind on what has been written. Putting focus into that console view and using the go-to-end-of-document key just skips down a few pages and starts scrolling again. This has been going on for 5-10 minutes (yes, it's a HUGE amount of logged information!).
summary: Provide a way to tell the debugger's console/log views to skip straight to the bottom, bypassing intermediate lines

description:
From [this comment](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-247817#focus=Comments-27-4429090.0-0):
>I'm on Rider and this issue is started around ~20.3 EAP. I think I updated to Win 2004 build (still on it as I write this) some time earlier than 20.3 EAPs and had no issues but I'm not really sure 100%.
>
>Rider started with elevated privileges => it suggests to add scan exclusion => I click Configure automatically => Rider behaves like it did it (no errors) => I check in Windows Security->Virus&threat protection -> manage settings -> add|remove exclusions and see that it didn't add the excluded directory.
>And so this warning/suggestion shows itself every time I open solution.

I was able to reproduce the same issue with IDEA 2020.3 Nightly (and Windows 10 2004), nothing interesting is in the logs. Seems like our `WindowsDefenderChecker` is really unable to add an exclusion: either [this line](https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community/blob/ad322c6c5faefea1604f0a182f7534837e041376/platform/platform-impl/src/com/intellij/diagnostic/WindowsDefenderChecker.java#L338) couldn't call the corresponding command, or `ExecUtil.sudoAndGetOutput` is broken when running IntelliJ with administrator privileges on Windows.

IDEA version info:

description:
Please see attachments.

If there is a value Intellij doesn't know, e.g. whatever getSomething() returns, the spell checker checks the spelling as if "missing Value" was substituted in to the String. As a result, these are always marked as typos such as "thingmissing" and "Valuenot" which are not words we have actually typed.

Expected behaviour: Intellij does not substitute "missing Value", rather a space " ", before spell checking a String concatenation.

description:
When using tasks and contexts, you have option to create new tasks which also create new branch. However the task title can have invalid git characters and that will stop it from creating branch and proceeding. IntelliJ should strip all invalid git characters and create the branch as close it can to the title/summary/whatever-is-specified.

What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Open New Task...
2. Use title with invalid git character e.g. 'Fix: issue with CAT'

What is the expected result?
Expected result would be to strip all invalid git characters so title can be as verbose and pretty as possible and git branches can still be created without manual intervention.

What happens instead?
It fails to create git branch.

![Screenshot with issue](SS-2020-10-07T11.04.03@2x.png)
summary: Strip Invalid Git Characters from Branch Name

comments.text:
Duplicate of IDEA-207269.

I like the suggested solutions in its comments very much:
* [Change option to handle invalid characters instead spaces](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-207269#focus=Comments-27-4085976.0-0)
* [Add possibility to additionally define custom set of characters to replace](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-207269#focus=Comments-27-4311400.0-0)

These would also solve IDEA-250676 & IDEA-203652.
Yes that is a good solution and we should also consider ability to define you own custom set on top of standard illegal chars like it says in the comment. ðŸ‘

description:
-add the attached crd schema in the File | Settings | Languages & Frameworks | Kubernetes
-create the k8s resource by this schema:
```
kind: MyCrd1
#one file:
metadata:
  name: test
spec:
  steps:
    - - <cursor>
```
-call completion at the cursor place and complete `tasks`
Result: 
```
...
spec:
  steps:
    - - tasks:
        somebool: 
```
Should be:
```
spec:
  steps:
    - - tasks:
          somebool:
```
summary: Kubernetes: smart completion of required keys in case of array of arrays of objects is incorrect

comments.text:
the completion of  "spec:" is also incorrect
it completes:
```
spec:
  steps
```
But should complete:
```
spec:
  steps:
    - - <cursor>
```

the completion of "steps" see issue IDEA-252322
```
...
spec:
  <cursor>
```

description:
1. Wrong inspection for a string that it should be string
```
   sidecars:
    - name: sleep
      image: alpine:latest
      command: [sleep, 1d]   <- here should be String[], the inspection "String value expected" is displayed for `1d`, but it is a string
```

2. For these cases it is displayed that  "String value expected", but maybe we should also detect numbers as a String in these cases?
```
  arguments:
    parameters:
      - name: "x"
        value: 1        <- here  inspection "String value expected", by crd there should be String
```
and
Array of strings
```
        args:
          - exit
          - 0    <- here inspection  "String value expected "
```
summary: Kubernetes: Some inspections that check strings  are wrong - in case of arrays and in case of numbers

comments.text:
3. I suppose that these cases are correct. To be sure, please, look through:
```
apiVersion: argoproj.io/v1alpha1
kind: Workflow
metadata:
  generateName: invalid-spec2-
spec:
  entrypoint: [thisshouldnotbeanarray]    <- here the  inspection "Single value is expected", by crd there should be a String
```
and 
`withItems: [1, 2, 3, 4]`   <- here the inspection "Scalar value is not allowed here" is present here, by crd there should be an array of objects
or
```
            withItems:
              - "1"     <- here the inspection "Scalar value is not allowed here" is present here, by crd there should be an array of objects
              - "2"
```
or
```
        withItems:
        - foo    <- here the inspection "Scalar value is not allowed here" is present here, by crd there should be an array of objects
        - bar
```

description:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. checkout a branch
2. switch to a branch including a lot of changes

What is the expected result?
All (new) packages are known and every class is recognized by intellij. 
What happens instead?
Some packages and classes are not known anymore. And due to that, it seems like there are compilation errors.  As you can see in the screenshot, the import of the package "de.immomio.data.shared.bean.note.NoteBean" results in an error, even if it exists as you can see. After invalidate the cache and restart it works again.
summary: Switching branches with a lot of changes leads to issues
GitHub: Add an option to attach pictures to a comment

comments.text: Unfortunately GitHub doesn't provide an API for uploading files to be used in comments. Currently it is impossible to implement the feature.

Often (50% cases) after the Kubernetes&GoTemplate plugin installation/updating and restart: the UI is OK (actions are present, the cluster info if present) but if I call actions, for example

It should work after the first restart.
summary: Kubernetes: not all actions work after the plugin update/installation.

description:
```kt val a = "
" ``` 1. show context actions 2. inject language or reference Expected: A checkbox on the language picker dialogue "Annotate injection": ![](image.png) Also once a language has been injected, a new Context Action should be shown "Annotate Language Injection": End result: ```kt import org.intellij.lang.annotations.Language @Language("HTML") val a = "
" ``` Maybe this could be applied to IDEA in general instead of just Kotlin, it's just that Kotlin comes bundled with `org.intellij.lang.annotations.Language`
summary: Add checkbox and intention "annotate language" for injected language fragment

comments.text: For other languages the injection could be added via the comment method `// language=HTML`
Do you have the **Settings (Preferences on macOS) | Editor | Language Injections | Advanced | Add @Language annotation or comment if needed** checkbox set? https://i.imgur.com/nMuZCoK.png

Oh, I didn't know that feature existed.

Yeah that works as expected, but I think it would be much more friendly(and discoverable) to have an implementation as per my feature request.

description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new cucumber project
2. Create methods with ru cucumber expressions, which contain optionals (https://cucumber.io/docs/cucumber/cucumber-expressions/#optional-text)
3. Create methods with en cucumber expressions, which contain optionals (https://cucumber.io/docs/cucumber/cucumber-expressions/#optional-text)
3. Create feature files in project with tests in ru and en languages

Expected result:
ru and en scenarios should have identically display

What happens instead?
ru scenarios don't have the same display as correct en scenarios
1. First step with optional text is marked as step with parameter
2. Second step with optional is text marked as undefined step

For faster problem localization you could use my project https://github.com/zglrx99/ru-undefined-step-issue
summary: Incorrect display of ru steps with optionals via cucumber plugin

removed:
I would very much like to see support for diffing things come to lite-edit mode. In particular, textual diff/merge functionality would be very useful in lite-edit mode.

Today I needed to diff some text in my browser with some text in a file, and I don't have great text editing tools other than IntelliJ. So I went and opened IntelliJ in lite-edit mode thinking I could just right click on some text and choose "compare with clipboard". Much to my dismay, the option isn't there.

Is it ~really~ a big deal if I have to open a project to use the diff tools? Not at all. But it would be nice to have this capability. :-)

I would very much like to see support for diffing things come to lite-edit mode. In particular, textual diff/merge functionality would be very useful in lite-edit mode.

Today I needed to diff some text in my browser with some text in a file, and I don't have great text editing tools other than IntelliJ. So I went and opened IntelliJ in lite-edit mode thinking I could just right click on some text and choose "compare with clipboard". Much to my dismay, the option isn't there.

Is it _really_ a big deal if I have to open a project to use the diff tools? Not at all. But it would be nice to have this capability. :-)

added.text:
I think the problem is that IDEA does not have https proxy. It only has options for HTTP and SOCKS.
And remote TestNG needs to use https proxy to access the https DTD link.

So there are two problems here:
1) IDEA uses TestNG 7.x to generate data (temp-testng-customsuite.xml) for TestNG 6.8.9
(Then TestNG 6.8.9 does not recognize the https DTD URL and tries to fetch it instead of using the bundled one.)
2) There are no https proxy settings in IDEA so TestNG 6.8.9 cannot access the https URL to download the DTD

Fixing either of them would eliminate the problem. But I believe both this issues should be fixed.

target.text:

(Then TestNG 6.8.9 does not recognize the https DTD URL and tries to fetch it instead of using the bundled one.)
2) There are no https proxy settings in IDEA so TestNG 6.8.9 cannot access the https URL to download the DTD

Fixing either of them would eliminate the problem. But I believe both this issues should be fixed.

added.text:
Fair enough.

However when I run the tests in Maven it uses (I suppose) system settings via the environment variables.
But IDEA does not take those variables into account when running the tests.

How am I supposed to pass the environment settings to the tests? I do not want to add `-Dhttp.proxy...` to every ad-hoc test run.
And adding these to some template does not work either if environment changes (VPN => use proxy, no VPN => no proxy).

added.text:
IDEA generates test suite outside of test process while maven does it in the same process. I don't think that testng run from maven loads dtd from internet, it must recognise the dtd url and loads dtd from resources of that jar. 
I didn't see any code in testng to pass proxies but you may contact testng team for this question. But again I don't think that IDE should pass any such settings to tests automatically.

added.text:
You could add `-Dhttps.proxyHost=... -Dhttps.proxyPort=...` to the VM parameters of the test run configuration.
Or upgrade your project to TestNG 7.x

It's probably better to put these settings into the TestNG run configuration template. This way they will be applied automatically every time you press Ctrl+Shift+F10.

You are right. Maven probably does not do anything with env variables by default.

Otherwise enabling/disabling VPN would require manual flipping of the tests proxy settings in IDEA.

Duplicate of IDEA-207269.

I like the suggested solutions in its comments very much:
* [Change option to handle invalid characters instead spaces](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-207269#focus=Comments-27-4085976.0-0)
* [Add possibility to additionally define custom set of characters to replace](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-207269#focus=Comments-27-4311400.0-0)

These would also solve IDEA-250676 & IDEA-203652.

kind: Workflow
metadata:
  generateName: invalid-spec2-
spec:
  entrypoint: [thisshouldnotbeanarray]    <- here the  inspection "Single value is expected", by crd there should be a String
```
and 
`withItems: [1, 2, 3, 4]`   <- here the inspection "Scalar value is not allowed here" is present here, by crd there should be an array of objects
or
```
            withItems:
              - "1"     <- here the inspection "Scalar value is not allowed here" is present here, by crd there should be an array of objects
              - "2"
```
or
```
        withItems:
        - foo    <- here the inspection "Scalar value is not allowed here" is present here, by crd there should be an array of objects
        - bar
```

What steps will reproduce the issue?

3. run test unit

What is the expected result?
It should run the test.

What happens instead?
Getting error:
Unrecognized option: --illegal-access=permit
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.

Environment:
Mac 10
Intellij idea 2019.2

It seems Intellij idea is passing "--illegal-access" option regardless of java version.
Overwriting the option in "JVM options" doesn't help since this option is not supported in JVM 8.

removed:
Because the menu checkmark icon (`idea/community/platform/platform-impl/src/com/intellij/ide/ui/laf/icons/intellij/checkmark.svg`) uses a different shade of gray (`#3E3E3C`) instead of the action icon gray (`#6E6E6E`) it not only looks darker. It also ignores the color value provided by the UI theme.

![](image.png)

The same can be said about the menu checkmark icon form the default dark scheme (`idea/community/platform/platform-impl/src/com/intellij/ide/ui/laf/icons/darcula/checkmark.svg`). It uses white (`#FFF`) while other icons use other color (`#AFB1B3`).

I would also suggest to review other LaF icons -- it seems they use the colors which are no longer in use in other places of the UI. And these colors are effectifely hard-coded values.

Possibly reverting to "alphabetical" even though the option is not selected
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Set code completion options like so: (I think this is the default or pretty close to default) also having ML Assisted Completions on or off makes no difference
![](image.png)
2. In a java project have a simple block of code like this:
![](image1.png)

What's expected?
I expect to see bigDecimal2 as the first suggested completion because IntelliJ is smart and it knows I want to use it because I used it on the line before and this used to work 100%.

What happens instead?
As seen on the above screenshot the completion order is
- bigDecimal1
- bigDecimal2
even though bigDecimal2 is defined after bigDecimal1 and I have just used bigDecimal2 on the line immediately preceding this completion. 

It seems at least the variables and parameter completions are always sorted alphabetically even though that option is off. Having ML completions enabled makes absolutely no difference (and no up/down ranking arrows are visible in the completion popup either)

Even worse example:
![](image2.png)
In this code block IntelliJ is suggesting "params" first after typing "pa" instead of paymentInstalment that was used on 6 previous lines.

added.text:
Can you clarify the problem please. Do you mean that sounds from PulseAudio are produced with a delays or not working? Do you have it for certain applications?

Can you record a sample showing the problem? From the video in AS issue tracker the problem is not quite clear.

Have you tried searching for solutions like https://askubuntu.com/questions/707171/how-can-i-fix-choppy-audio ?

Please check also if it makes a different to enable File | Power Save Mode or leave the IDE idle for a while?

Please attach all IDE logs (Help | Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data) and OS system log at the moment when issue happens. Not sure if PulseAudio has any diagnostics logs, if it has please attach it also. Thanks.

added.text:
> Can you clarify the problem please. Do you mean that sounds from PulseAudio are produced with a delays or not working?
> 
> Can you record a sample showing the problem? From the video in AS issue tracker the problem is not quite clear.

I think I can't help if you don't hear a problem, these loud glitches. I can suggest you to use some audio-spectrum maybe. And sorry, but I don't understand "a sample showing the problem", when the existing record is it.

I can highlight some timestamps on this video: 1:12, 1:17, 1:31, 3:10, 3:43, 3:58, 4:00, 4:26, 4:28.

But after reviewing a record I noticed that there are a way less these glitches than I hear in real-life. I don't know how to record them properly.

I've attached a new video, with Intellij IDEA, highlights are: 0:55, 0:59, 1:43, 1:46, 2:02, 2:17.

You can also see the System Monitor, glitches are here even in idle state, with regular CPU usage.

> Do you have it for certain applications?

I've tested Chromium and Spotify (desktop client), I'm not interested in other audio applications.

> Have you tried searching for solutions like https://askubuntu.com/questions/707171/how-can-i-fix-choppy-audio ?

In the AS issue you can see a link to the question on the same Ask Ubuntu: https://askubuntu.com/questions/1183509/pulseaudio-lags-horribly-only-when-android-studio-is-running

There is pretty similar question to my: I've also tried listed solutions, including disabling timer-based audio scheduling (this is also mentioned in Arch Wiki: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/PulseAudio/Troubleshooting#Glitches,_skips_or_crackling).

> Please check also if it makes a different to enable File | Power Save Mode or leave the IDE idle for a while?

Yes, glitches are happening in Power Save Mode.

> Please attach all IDE logs (Help | Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data)

Done.

> and OS system log at the moment when issue happens

I don't know where is a "OS system log" for Arch Linux, but I see nothing in `journalctl -f` at these moments.

> Not sure if PulseAudio has any diagnostics logs, if it has please attach it also.

I've attached the output of `pulseaudio -vvvvv` (after `pulseaudio -k`). You can see strange lines, almost all of them were at sound cracks, but not on every crack there was a record in output. Then I've paused the video and you can see disconnection logs. Then, at `---` line (added manually), I've closed Intellij IDEA and resumed the video, so these logs, after `---`, are "normal".

> Can you record a sample showing the problem? From the video in AS issue tracker the problem is not quite clear.

I think I can't help if you don't hear a problem, these loud glitches. I can suggest you to use some audio-spectrum maybe. And sorry, but I don't understand "a sample showing the problem", when the existing record is it.

I can highlight some timestamps on this video: 1:12, 1:17, 1:31, 3:10, 3:43, 3:58, 4:00, 4:26, 4:28.

But after reviewing a record I noticed that there are a way less these glitches than I hear in real-life. I don't know how to record them properly.

I've attached a new video, with Intellij IDEA, highlights are: 0:55, 0:59, 1:43, 1:46, 2:02, 2:17.

You can also see the System Monitor, glitches are here even in idle state, with regular CPU usage.

> Do you have it for certain applications?

I've tested Chromium and Spotify (desktop client), I'm not interested in other audio applications.

> Have you tried searching for solutions like https://askubuntu.com/questions/707171/how-can-i-fix-choppy-audio ?

In the AS issue you can see a link to the question on the same Ask Ubuntu: https://askubuntu.com/questions/1183509/pulseaudio-lags-horribly-only-when-android-studio-is-running

There is pretty similar question to my: I've also tried listed solutions, including disabling timer-based audio scheduling (this is also mentioned in Arch Wiki: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/PulseAudio/Troubleshooting#Glitches,_skips_or_crackling).

> Please check also if it makes a different to enable File | Power Save Mode or leave the IDE idle for a while?

Yes, glitches are happening in Power Save Mode.

> Please attach all IDE logs (Help | Collect Logs and Diagnostic Data)

Done.

> and OS system log at the moment when issue happens

I don't know where is a "OS system log" for Arch Linux, but I see nothing in `journalctl -f` at these moments.

> Not sure if PulseAudio has any diagnostics logs, if it has please attach it also.

I've attached the output of `pulseaudio -vvvvv` (after `pulseaudio -k`). You can see strange lines, almost all of them were at sound cracks, but not on every crack there was a record in output. Then I've paused the video and you can see disconnection logs. Then, at `---` line (added manually), I've closed Intellij IDEA and resumed the video, so these logs, after `---`, are "normal".

added.text:
Thank you for details. Latter video describe the problem better. Have no ideas what could be causing this. See no issues in IDE log. I'd assume that this could be some bug of audio driver or PulseAudio. Not sure if it is related to CPU consumption as the audio chokes also what IDE is idle as far as I can see from the last video. It would probably make sense to report the issue to PulseAudio https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/pulseaudio/pulseaudio/-/issues with logs provided.

From the IDE's side I could suggest to try using different JBR to run IDE under: https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/switching-boot-jdk.html (try 8 or 11 versions).

After swapping the bytecode with an older version I got it how it was before.

added.text:
If someone wants to get the older behavior, since this is really **annoying**, it's possible to use Recaf (as in this case, or others) to edit the bytecode.
Starting from `{IDEA-INSTALL-DIR}\lib\platform-impl.jar\com\intellij\openapi\editor\impl\EditorGutterComponentImpl.class`
```
1 DEFINE PRIVATE calcAnnotationExtraSize()V
```
Then
```
24 INVOKEDYNAMIC test ()Ljava/util/function/Predicate; ${H_META} args[(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z, handle[H_INVOKESTATIC com/intellij/openapi/editor/impl/EditorGutterComponentImpl.lambda$calcAnnotationExtraSize$5(Ljava/awt/Component;)Z], (Ljava/awt/Component;)Z]
25 INVOKESTATIC com/intellij/ui/ComponentUtil.findParentByCondition(Ljava/awt/Component;Ljava/util/function/Predicate;)Ljava/awt/Component;
```
must be replaced with
```
24 INVOKESTATIC javax/swing/SwingUtilities.getWindowAncestor(Ljava/awt/Component;)Ljava/awt/Window;
```

target.text:
If someone wants to get the older behavior, since this is really **annoying**, it's possible to use Recaf (as in this case, or others) to edit the bytecode.
Starting from `{IDEA-INSTALL-DIR}\lib\platform-impl.jar\com\intellij\openapi\editor\impl\EditorGutterComponentImpl.class`
```
1 DEFINE PRIVATE calcAnnotationExtraSize()V
```
Then
```
24 INVOKEDYNAMIC test ()Ljava/util/function/Predicate; ${H_META} args[(Ljava/lang/Object;)Z, handle[H_INVOKESTATIC com/intellij/openapi/editor/impl/EditorGutterComponentImpl.lambda$calcAnnotationExtraSize$5(Ljava/awt/Component;)Z], (Ljava/awt/Component;)Z]
25 INVOKESTATIC com/intellij/ui/ComponentUtil.findParentByCondition(Ljava/awt/Component;Ljava/util/function/Predicate;)Ljava/awt/Component;
```
must be replaced with
```
24 INVOKESTATIC javax/swing/SwingUtilities.getWindowAncestor(Ljava/awt/Component;)Ljava/awt/Window;
```

removed:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Bring up search bar
2. Resize search bar
3. Close search bar
4. Open search bar again

What is the expected result?
Size from when resized is kept when opening a second time.

What happens instead?
Size is reset.  This happens even if in the same session and without even changing files or anything else.  Just opening twice in the same file.

removed:
Hi!
If there is a Runnable implementation in the call chain IDEA tries to add all calls on all Runnable implementations in the project and all library to the tool window, which leads to high RAM and CPU load and the app stuck.
Expected behavior: add calls only for current Runnable implementation
![](image.png)

IU-202.7319.50, JRE 11.0.8+10-b944.31x64 JetBrains s.r.o., OS Windows 10(amd64) v10.0 , screens 2048x1152, 1536x864, 1536x960
added:
Hi!
If there is a Runnable implementation in the call chain IDEA tries to add all calls on all Runnable implementations in the project and all library to the tool window, which leads to high RAM and CPU load and the app stuck. The one way to finish it - is to restart IDEA.
Expected behavior: add calls only for current Runnable implementation

		<dependency>
			<groupId></groupId>
			<artifactId></artifactId>

added.text:
Hey, I am the one that caused this issue to be created.
First of all thank you for the workaround using external annotations of `@NonNls`.
But what I was "really" asking for was to ignore annotation element values altogether for the given inspection because as per [JLS Chapter 9](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.7) an annotation element value can only contain constant expressions ([JLS Chapter 15](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-15.html#jls-15.28)), class literals, enum constants or other annotations (or ConditionalExpressions or ElementValueArrayInitializer that contain those) all of which are by definition not translatable (or at least not in a way that I currently know).
I just does not make sense to have any annotation element value be contained in this inspection.

target.text:
Hey, I am the one that caused this issue to be created.

But what I was "really" asking for was to ignore annotation element values altogether for the given inspection because as per [JLS Chapter 9](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.7) an annotation element value can only contain constant expressions ([JLS Chapter 15](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se8/html/jls-15.html#jls-15.28)), class literals, enum constants or other annotations (or ConditionalExpressions or ElementValueArrayInitializer that contain those) all of which are by definition not translatable (or at least not in a way that I currently know).
I just does not make sense to have any annotation element value be contained in this inspection.

added.text:
> CACHING OPTIONS FOR VOLUME MOUNTS (DOCKER DESKTOP FOR MAC)
> You can configure container-and-host consistency requirements for bind-mounted directories in Compose files to allow for better performance on read/write of volume mounts. These options address issues specific to osxfs file sharing, and therefore are only applicable on Docker Desktop for Mac.

> The flags are:

> consistent: Full consistency. The container runtime and the host maintain an identical view of the mount at all times. This is the default.
> cached: The hostâ€™s view of the mount is authoritative. There may be delays before updates made on the host are visible within a container.
> delegated: The container runtimeâ€™s view of the mount is authoritative. There may be delays before updates made in a container are visible on the host.

Does it help if you change `cached` to `consistent` in `docker-compose.yml`?

target.text:

> consistent: Full consistency. The container runtime and the host maintain an identical view of the mount at all times. This is the default.
> cached: The hostâ€™s view of the mount is authoritative. There may be delays before updates made on the host are visible within a container.
> delegated: The container runtimeâ€™s view of the mount is authoritative. There may be delays before updates made in a container are visible on the host.

Does it help if you change `cached` to `consistent` in `docker-compose.yml`?

removed:
What steps will reproduce the issue?
1. Download Gradle 6.6.1
2. Generate new project with `gradle init` (type=application, language=kotlin, build-script-dsl=kotlin)
3. Open project in IntelliJ and reimport the Gradle project to trigger downloading all plugins, dependencies and source jars.
4. Open build.gradle.kts file
5. configure test task in any way

What is the expected result?
There are no syntax errors.

What happens instead?
- `tasks.withType<Test> {}` is marked as an error with the message `"Type argument is not within its bounds."`. (See attached screenshot.)
- The superclass being marked in red in the JavaDoc leads me to believe that this problem may be a classpath problem related to resolving the superclass AbstractTestTask.
- Navigating to implementaion works with all classes in the hierarchy despite the superclass being marked as red.
- The breadcrumbs for the file show `<class initializer>` for the three lines configuring the test task. This is however also the case for the other configuration lambdas where the syntax-check is ok. Just thought that that is weird.
- Gradle finishes configuration and test execution phases without any errors. This leads me to believe that all classes are present at the very least during execution and that it is IntelliJs classpath mechanism that does not find them all.
- Autocomplete works to some degree: Basic code completion finds the generics-based `withType()` extension method in the kotlin-dsl subproject of the gradle sources but navigate to implementation navigates to the java-based gradle api.
- The behaviour is unrelated to the version of the kotlin gradle plugin.

This issue may possibly be related to KT-42535 where the classpath for gradle kotlin-dsl scripts is also broken.
